alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 8:11PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. .Water levels continue to rise on the Sand Hill River, with Moderate Stage being reached mid week. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sand Hill River at Climax. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Hwy 75 north of Climax is closed and underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Saturday was 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.0 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
